Definition: An iOS feature that lets users change navigation options (like by headings or links) using a circular dial gesture.
A method where users move their finger around the screen to hear item names and information.
Android’s screen reader that provides spoken feedback and uses gestures for navigation and interaction.
A TalkBack menu that offers actions specific to the selected item or screen context.
A specific finger movement (like swipe or tap) that performs a screen reader command.
